intro: Dactylorhiza × ishorica, commonly known as the hybrid marsh orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to western Europe. It is a hybrid between Dactylorhiza maculata and Dactylorhiza viridiflora, exhibiting a mix of characteristics from both parent species. The plant typically grows in wet, boggy habitats and has a slender, erect stem with lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with purple markings, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Dactylorhiza × ishorica is relatively easy to cultivate in moist, well-drained conditions.
